text:
Outlaws still is one of my all time favorite games ever and my second favorite FPS (right behind Return to Castle Wolfenstein or Half Life 2, I can't decide). But it is by far my favorite soundtrack in any video game ever. It's just like being in a Sergio Leone movie!
I'm glad it finally got released on GOG.
author: Hairy Cornflake

text: Careful, you're gonna make me want to buy this.
author: jdng86

text:
Yep...yep...
Me and this game, man, we go back, WAYYY back. One of my first games! Wonderful game, still holds up to this day.

Oh, and also: "DON'T BE A FOOOOOOOL, MARSHALL"
author: The Real Sean W. Stewart

text:
This rootin' tootin' six shooter of a game got put on GoG last week.
You would be a foolish Marshal to not play it.

text: Clint Bajakian is one of the most underrated VGM composers and one of my favorites. Great selection!

author: DScribbleF

text: Great western FPS from Lucas Arts. This theme is quite varied, starting calm but slowly building up to a great spaghetti western track. I especially like the break at 2:06.
author: SupraDarky

text: I remember the demo, or rather the freeware portion of this game. It was cool. I remember there were giant tarantulas in a cave part that scared the shit out of me as a child. Plus the boss of the freeware level was really tough, for me at least.
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi
